data.sampled: The determinant of the matrix can be calculated using the LaTeX command `$$\det(\text{matrix})=\pm (n \cdot a_{1,1} \cdot\ldots \cdot a_{1,n}\cdot a_{2,1} \cdot\ldots \cdot a_{2,n}\cdot \ldots \cdot a_{n,1} \cdot\ldots \cdot a_{n,n})$$`, where `n` is the number of rows and columns in the matrix, `a_{i,j}` is the element at row `i` and column `j` in the matrix, and the value of the determinant is given by the product of the diagonal elements of the matrix.
